caption.title: Power to detect simulated correlation QTL across a wide range of scenarios (n = 1000 for all simulations).

tr.td: (2) Genotype predicts the mean of gene one expression levels† (e.g., through an eQTL or proportion QTL)
(3) Genotype predicts the mean of gene two expression levels†
(4) Genotype predicts the variance of gene one expression levels‡ (e.g., through a varQTL)
(5) A variable that is random with respect to genotype predicts the mean of gene one expression levels†(e.g., through technical, environmental, or cell type heterogeneity effects)
(6) A variable that is random with respect to genotype predicts the mean of gene two expression levels†
(7) A variable that is random with respect to genotype predicts the variance of gene one expression levels‡(e.g., through technical, environmental, or cell type heterogeneity effects)
(8) A variable that is random with respect to genotype predicts the variance of gene two expression levels‡
Power (proportion of true positives detected, Bonferroni-corrected p<0.05)
False positive rate (proportion of true negatives detected, nominal p<0.05)

fn.p: Simulated effect sizes were as follows: correlation QTL* = 0.3, mean effects† = 1, variance effects ‡ = 10. When Bonferroni-corrected p-values were used, the false positive rate was 0 across all simulation scenarios. Abbreviations: eQTL = expression QTL and vQTL = variance QTL.
